main_definition: The process of arranging text, data or information in a particular way to make it more organized and readable.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Adjusting the layout and appearance of documents using styles and settings.
meanings_and_examples.example: Before printing an essay, I formatted the document by adjusting font size, line spacing, and margins.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Changing data types to make it suitable for processing or storage in a computer system.
meanings_and_examples.example: When importing files into Excel, formatting included converting date strings into proper dates for calculations.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Setting up and preparing text by applying different styles like bold, italic, underline, etc., to enhance readability.
meanings_and_examples.example: I formatted the title of my research paper as uppercase and highlighted key words using bold type.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Organizing information in a structured format such as tables, lists, or bullet points for easier understanding.
meanings_and_examples.example: The presentation had several slides that were formatted with bullet points to break down complex data into digestible chunks.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Creating visual appeal and consistency in design by applying a consistent style guide across documents or content.
meanings_and_examples.example: Our company uses a specific formatting template for all official correspondence, ensuring uniformity in appearance.
